intro: Luetzelburgia bahiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, tomatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom at night, attracting specific pollinators. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its fruit is a small, fleshy berry. Due to its ornamental value and unique blooming pattern, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
